pr_title: Add Wynn to fingerprint to support Old English texts

timeline.bodyText:
Is case folding not working correctly? We shouldn't need two entries.
As long as we're doing this, should we map the rest of the wynn forms? http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/search.htm?q=wynn&preview=entity
All runes? http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/search.htm?q=runic&preview=entity
timeline.author: tfmorris
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -85,6 +85,8 @@
             .put("œ", "oe")
             .put("ẜ", "s") // more long S forms
             .put("ẝ", "s")
+            .put("Ƿ","w") // Wynn from Old English modernly transliterated to w

replies.bodyText:
You can take this PR over Tom.  I've got what I needed out of of it to unblock me.  If it's useful for others or needs more work to be more useful...have at it.
Sorry I don't understand what you mean about the case folding.  I didn't see case (capitals) applied if that's what you mean, but I do have them in the examples in the issue.
replies.author: thadguidry

replies.bodyText: The mapping that I was following was from the Unicode spec itself.  In particular the scf and slc, which I still find a bit weird on some glyphs.  http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr44/tr44-14.html#Regular_Expressions_Table
replies.author: thadguidry

replies.bodyText: and where I was trying to get fingerprint and ngramFingerprint to follow the rules of scf and slc by default.  If that's reading too much into it, then I goofed and sorry, but felt they were sensible most of the time for Old English texts.
replies.author: thadguidry

replies.bodyText: The string is lowercased before it gets to this point, so only the lowercase substitution is needed.
replies.author: tfmorris

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    // WIP: These we know should be folded based on research (Wikipedia,etc.), and modern expectations (transliterations) by researchers (philologists)
          
          
            
                    {"Ƿƿ",
          
          
            
                     "ww"},
          
          
            
                    {"Ƿƿ", "ww"}, // Old English letter wynn
          
      
    
    
  

Let's also relocate this up below the test for eth and thorn since they're similar.
timeline.author: tfmorris

timeline.message: Add Wynn to fingerprint to support Old English texts
